page.title: 02TRAFFIC FLOW SURVEY _ 1985.
page.content: {Bangor}is one of the main dormitory towns for Belfast,the capital of Northern Ireland. A large percentage of the population travels daily to that city. As a result two peak-traffic periods are noted daily along the main road networks to the A2:- (1) 08.00 _ 09.00 to Belfast { }(2) 17.00 _ 18.30 to Bangor The traffic flow and population grew steadily in the 1960's with the result that a dual carriageway or "Ring-Road" was opened in 1968 to reduce traffic movement through the centre of Bangor at all times. { { {To test if such was happening or not {in 1985 a road traffic flow survey was {carried out at non _ peak time over a {30 minute period in two locations:_ { (1) 480800 (2) 510800
